node.title: The Only Mother on the Court
node.description: Justice Amy Coney Barrett seemed to lean into identity politics at Wednesday’s arguments over a major abortion case.

node.title: U.S. imposes first cybersecurity rules for rail transit
node.description: The new measures are part of an effort to shore up critical infrastructure after a number of ransomware attacks this year.

node.title: Curley Culp, Defensive Anchor of Two Football Teams, Dies at 75
node.description: A bruising Hall of Famer, Culp helped lead the Kansas City Chiefs to an upset victory in Super Bowl IV. With the Houston Oilers, he revolutionized the role of nose tackle.

node.title: F.T.C. Sues to Block the Chip Maker Nvidia’s Takeover of the Chip Designer Arm
node.description: The proposed deal would give Nvidia control over computing technology and designs that rival firms rely on.

node.title: Omicron prompts scientists to reconsider the need for boosters.
node.description: By Apoorva Mandavilli

node.title: Russia Deploys Missiles, Stations Personnel on Island in Middle of Chain Claimed by Japan
node.description: The deployment comes as speculation continues about a Russian invasion of Ukraine.

node.title: Joe Biden Says No Government Shutdown Unless Someone 'Decides to Be Totally Erratic'
node.description: Lawmakers have until Friday at midnight to pass a measure to keep the federal government operating.

node.title: Former Teacher Forced to Resign Over Facebook Post About Mask Mandates, Lawsuit Claims
node.description: The lawsuit alleges the video was posted on the teacher's personal Facebook account, which was operating under a pseudonym.

node.title: Hobartians mopping up after intense storms, power outages
node.description: Hobart last night saw storms that washed away cars, "damaging" winds and unusually large hail, the Bureau of Meteorology says.

node.title: Emergency alert issued for Chinchilla, as rain finally clears across southern Queensland
node.description: Chinchilla residents are warned properties may be flooded this morning as Charleys Creek peaks, and Goondiwindi is also on alert as floodwaters from Inglewood reach the border town.

node.title: Airlines still owe billions in refunds for cancelled flights
node.description: Federal government received nearly 90,000 complaints about flight refunds last year, up more than 5,000% from 2019.

node.title: Ron Cephas Jones Has Something to Prove Again
node.description: The Emmy-winning “This Is Us” actor received a double-lung transplant after a secret battle with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease. Now he’s back onstage in “Clyde’s” on Broadway.

node.title: What African Americans Thought of Barack Obama
node.description: Claude A. Clegg III’s “The Black President” looks at the often surprising reactions of African Americans to the Obama administration.

node.title: What’s in Our Queue? ‘The Loneliest Americans’ and More
node.description: I'm one of the Culture desk's general-assignment reporters. Here are five things I've been watching, reading and listening to.

node.title: ‘Citizen Ashe’ Review: Advantage, Arthur Ashe
node.description: This warm, sympathetic documentary portrait traces the career of the tennis champion and pioneer who smashed through history.

node.title: Three Great Documentaries to Stream
node.description: A look at standout nonfiction films, from classics to overlooked recent works, that will reward your time.

node.title: A Tiny Home of One’s Own
node.description: Do these shelters help those living on the streets or just offer political cover?

node.title: A Way to Break the Cycle of Poverty
node.description: Intervening in children’s lives early can help break the cycle of intergenerational poverty.

node.title: The Metaverse Is Coming, and the World Is Not Ready for It
node.description: The geopolitical consequences may be radical.

node.title: Review Finds No Answers to Mystery of Havana Syndrome
node.description: Some officials remain convinced Russia is involved, but so far there is no evidence pointing to a particular adversary and no one has detected microwaves or other possible weapons.

node.title: A Double Resignation Shakes Austrian Politics in Aftermath of Scandal
node.description: Sebastian Kurz, a former chancellor under investigation for influence-buying and corruption, said he was quitting politics. Within hours, his successor and ally also resigned, after only two months on the job.

node.title: Travelers to U.S. Count the Hours: Can They Get Their Tests Back in Time?
node.description: New travel restrictions announced on Thursday by the White House over fears of the spread of the Omicron variant have many worrying that their trips may not happen.

node.title: Macri, Ex-President of Argentina, Is Charged With Illegal Surveillance
node.description: The former leader has called the case politically motivated and denies that his government spied on relatives of sailors who died in a submarine accident in 2017.

node.title: U.N. Predicts 274M People Will Need Humanitarian Aid in 2022, Appeals for $41B From Donors
node.description: OCHA officials believe there will be a 17 percent increase of people in 2022 who need immediate humanitarian aid.

node.title: Nearly 200 Children Involved in Trampoline Park 'Brawl': 'This Escalated Very Quickly'
node.description: "They were all having fun and then when this lady said, 'Oh my God,' and I turn around to look, they're fighting on the right side," said Sandra Bermudez.

node.title: Over 100 People Show Up to Help Save Stranded Fish After Montana Dam Malfunctions
node.description: Volunteers sprung into action after a gate malfunction at Hebgen Dam suddenly dropped water levels, leaving fish stranded in the open air.

node.title: Indigenous man flees town after seeing video of cop threatening to 'flog' him
node.description: Police say they are conducting internal inquiries after the emergence of footage showing a Cunnamulla officer threatening to "flog" and "hurt" a local.

node.title: Woodside faces new legal challenge over Scarborough gas
node.description: Conservationists double down on their determination to fight Woodside's plan to build the $16.5 billion Scarborough gas project, as a new report finds the domestic gas supply provided by the project is likely to exceed forecast demand.

node.title: Higher prices predicted for watermelons, chilli after torrential rain destroys summer crops
node.description: Australians are set to pay a premium for popular summer produce, with widespread storms destroying crops across Queensland. Some growers say the deluge has wiped out up to 85 per cent of their crops.

node.title: Senators press student loan servicers ahead of repayment restart
node.description: Some of those borrowers will have to restart paying their federal student loans to a new company.
